Whereas Larry was born in Pueblo, Colorado, to Aubree and Harriet Ambrose in 1945, Aubrey owned two businesses an Army, Army, Navy surplus store and a shoe store. And whereas, Larry graduated from Pueblo Central High, attended CU Boulder as a marketing major, and attended UCLA obtaining a business and arts'

'speaker_3': 'degree in 1968, being the first person in the country to get a degree in arts administration. And. Whereas, Larry began his career as an impresario of the arts at the age of nine, promoting the fledgling piano talents of his friend Fred Winger in a local talent contest.'

'speaker_3': 'Fred went on to become a noted pianist. He later mangled a number of managed forgive me, managed a number of bands, including Ashgrove Club, LA's number one place for life music and managed a band. Musicians originally from San Francisco living in a commune in Walsenburg and recognized the remarkable talent of a new friend.'

'speaker_3': 'He had made a Denver woman who had never performed in public but had a great voice. He urged her to sit in at one of his band rehearsals and give it a try. The audition didn't go particularly well, but Larry urged her not to give up.'

'speaker_3': 'That young woman. Laney Garrett, has become one of Denver's truly legendary entertainers, largely due to Larry's early encouragement. And. WHEREAS, Larry met Jane Parker in 1972 when she showed up at the Rio Grande Saloon on Santa Fe Drive looking for good, funky music.'

'speaker_3': 'She worked for the Denver Symphony. Jane ran into Larry again at a bar in Colorado and Evans four years later where his band was playing. And she said she remembered his eyes. Larry called her the next day to ask her out to listen to music.'

'speaker_3': 'And whereas Jane and Larry started seeing each other regularly and she moved into his house and became a part of the commune, she told Larry she wanted to get married and he said, okay. They eloped to Reno, Nevada, along with their friends, Judy and Jack Ratelle, who also tied the knot.'

'speaker_3': 'The Ambrose's traveled to Europe and Mexico and skiing and loved kite flying. Their home was always filled with friends, food, joy and love. Just like his family home in Pueblo. And. Whereas, from 1996 to 2014, Larry commuted back and forth to Pueblo to take care of his mother and to manage the family business.'
'speaker_3': 'While there, he was hired as the manager of the Pueblo Convention Center and turned it into a vibrant place with concerts and artists while still managing the family business. And.'

'speaker_8': 'Whereas, at the age of 59, Larry went to law school, earning a J.D., but was too busy with multiple jobs to study to pass the bar. And. Whereas, Larry was involved in the formation and advocacy of Denver neighborhood groups since 1973, when he and Jane started one of Denver's first Reno's Northwest neighbors.'

'speaker_8': 'And. Whereas, in early 1980s, Larry and Frank Quintana, former DFT captain, co-founded the Jefferson Highland Sunnyside Neighborhood Association. He and Jane helped pioneer the low Hyde business district on 15th Street, where they both had businesses in 2004 and were founding members of Sloan's Lake Neighborhood Association.'

'speaker_8': 'Where Larry served as vice president until his passing. And. Whereas, as community relations director of the Eraring campus, he wrote the policies on community use of space and more notably saved the Golda meir house from the wrecking ball when it was moved to the Ninth Street Historic District in 1988, where it was restored and named to the'

'speaker_8': 'National Register of Historic Places. And. Whereas, Larry was a member of the Plant Area Reclamation Committee, where he advocated for a major city park in the Central Platte Valley and was subsequently subsequently appointed by Mayor McNichols as the neighborhood representative to the Central Valley Planning Committee.'

'speaker_8': 'And. Whereas, Larry and Gertie Grant co-chaired a citywide building height control initiative that was on the ballot in 1985, he was a leader in saving historic buildings in the Highlands, in getting power lines buried in Highland Square business district.'
'speaker_8': 'He worked with Councilman Sal Carpio in creating the Viking Park entryway into northwest Denver and establishing Denver's system of dog parks.'

'speaker_7': 'And. WHEREAS, Larry served on numerous city planning committees and task force groups, he served on the Iron Board for nine years as secretary, vice president and president. He initiated the creation of Iron Sea's website, logo and branding. He established a record of activism and advocacy through Iron Sea resolutions to Denver City government officials and initiated at the'

'speaker_7': 'behest of Kathleen Wells, the creation of platforms for agencies committees, starting with parks. He formed the I.N.S. Parks Designation Committee and appointed his first members. He initiated the silent auction ad agency annual awards dinners and with help from Jane Lorimer, taking the dinners to a new level of success.'

'speaker_7': 'Larry, Larry Held Taking the dinners to a new level of success. Larry Held executive committee retreats for the first time. That included building agency's current mission statement to advocate for Denver citizens by bringing together, informing and empowering Denver neighborhood organizations to actively engage in addressing city issues.'

'speaker_7': 'In 2021, IAC gave Larry the Lifetime Achievement Achievement Award for his work in Denver communities. And. WHEREAS, Larry recently served as executive director for the Southwest Improvement Council even through the time he was sick. Swix purpose is to improve living conditions for its residents through civic engagement, health and human service programs and affordable housing.'

'speaker_7': 'And. Whereas, Larry enjoyed a life well lived with music, joy, purpose, meaning, connection, friendship and love. If you were a friend of Larry's, you are a friend for life. He indeed spent a lifetime of commitment to address the betterment of Denver's neighborhoods.'

'speaker_7': 'And whereas, Larry is survived by wife of 48 years. Jane Parker Ambrose. Cousin David. And Laura Houseman of Corpus Christi, Texas, and many, many other cousins. He was laid to rest on Tuesday, February one, 2022, at Emmanuel Cemetery within Fairmount Cemetery.'

'speaker_7': 'Now, therefore, let it be proclaimed by the Council of the City and County of Denver that the Section one that the Council of the City and County of Denver honors Larry Ambrose for his countless contributions to our community and declares today, February 14, 2022, to be Larry Ambrose Day and honors his memory.'

'speaker_7': 'Section two that the clerk of the city and county of Denver shall attest and to fix the seal of the city and county of Denver to this proclamation and a copy be provided to his wife, Jane Parker Ambrose.'
